intro: Verbascum wierzbickii, commonly known as the Wierzbicki mullein, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Verbascum wierzbickii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
